DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this study is to compare parenteral ceftriaxone and oral doxycycline in the treatment of neuroborreliosis in a randomized controlled trial.
DOC.brief_title: Effect of Intravenous Ceftriaxone and Oral Doxycycline for Lyme Neuroborreliosis
DOC.criteria: Neurological symptoms and/or findings consistent with neuroborreliosis and at least one of the following fulfilled: Intrathecal production of borrelia antibodies; White cell count in cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) > 5/mm3; Significant rise in borrelia antibodies in two serum samples collected from a patient with at least 3 weeks interval; Verified acrodermatitis chronica atrophicans. Allergy to the contents in the medication, or earlier type I reaction to penicillin. Treatment with cephalosporins, penicillin or tetracyclins during the last 14 days Pregnancy or breastfeeding Age < 18 years
